info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 2:18PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A BRIEF PERIOD OF HEAT INDICES AROUND 110 DEGREES EXPECTED THIS AFTERNOON... Temperatures rising into the mid to upper 90s combined with high humidity level near the inland moving sea breeze will produce a brief period of dangerous heat indices near 110 degrees. This brief surge of dangerous heat will only last 1 to 2 hours before temperatures cool ever so slightly as relatively cooler air moves inland from off the Atlantic.
info.instruction: Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible, reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear light weight and loose fitting clothing when possible and drink plenty of water.
